alert.note: Alert for Escambia Coastal; Okaloosa Coastal; Santa Rosa Coastal (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued December 24 at 4:34AM EST until December 26 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 9 PM CST THIS EVENING... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 3 AM CST MONDAY... ...HIGH SURF WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 9 AM CST MONDAY... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TO 9 PM CST MONDAY... * WHAT...For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents expected. For the first High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 4 to 7 feet expected in the surf zone. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, minor coastal flooding expected. For the High Surf Warning, dangerously large breaking waves of 6 to 10 feet expected in the surf zone. For the second High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 4 to 7 feet expected in the surf zone. * WHERE...In Alabama, Mobile Coastal and Baldwin Coastal Counties. In Florida, Escambia Coastal, Santa Rosa Coastal and Okaloosa Coastal Counties. * WHEN...For the High Rip Current Risk, through Tuesday afternoon. For the first High Surf Advisory, from noon today to 9 PM CST this evening. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, from 3 PM this afternoon to 3 AM CST Monday. For the High Surf Warning, from 9 PM this evening to 9 AM CST Monday. For the second High Surf Advisory, from 9 AM to 9 PM CST Monday. * IMPACTS...Minor coastal flooding and wave overwash expected. Breaking waves can sweep people off jetties and docks, and into dangerous seas. Life- threatening swimming conditions and significant beach erosion can be expected. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Significant wave runup and over-wash may occur along Gulf Front beaches, particularly in the Gulf Islands National Seashore area between Fort Pickens and Pensacola Beach. Wave runup and over-wash through the dune system can result in some minor flooding impacts on Fort Pickens Road, although the road usually remains open and passable.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Everyone should remain out of the water due to life-threatening surf conditions. Stay off of jetties, piers, and other waterside infrastructure. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.

area.areaDesc: Escambia Coastal; Okaloosa Coastal; Santa Rosa Coastal
